are getting very tired about hearing our Republican and right wing friends telling us about how Social Security is collapsing when the reality is, Social Security today has a surplus of$ 2.6 trillion,'' Sen. Bernie Sanders said. Social Security can pay out every benefit owed to every eligible American, for the next 27 years. Social Security has built up a$ 2.5 trillion surplus since the retirement program was last overhauled in the 1980s. Benefits will be safe until that money runs out. could be seeking a seventh term in Congress, although that seems unlikely, because Mike Pence voluntarily forfeited his position as the No. 3-ranking Republican in the U.S. House after Republicans swept into the majority in November. , 22:16 EST Google announced Thursday that co-founder Larry Page would replace Eric Schmidt as chief executive of the Internet giant in April. Google said Eric Schmidt would remain with the company as executive chairman and focus on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships. The firm's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , will work on strategic projects and new products, Google said in a statement. It said the management changes would take effect on April 4.
